original_solution_mapping.L1: Greg and Sarah will split their apples, so 18 apples / 2 = <<18/2=9>>9 apples per child.
original_solution_mapping.L4: Combined the children have 9 apples + 9 apples + 18 apples + 13 apples = <<9+9+18+13=49>>49 apples.
original_solution_mapping.L5: Mom will have 49 apples - 40 apples = <<49-40=9>>9 apples left over.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6192.
    Returns: the number of apples Mom will have left over.
    """
    # L1
    total_apples_to_split = 18 # 18 apples
    num_children_splitting = 2 # split evenly
    apples_per_child = total_apples_to_split / num_children_splitting

    # L2
    susan_multiplier = 2 # twice as many apples as Greg
    susan_apples = susan_multiplier * apples_per_child

    # L3
    mark_fewer_apples = 5 # 5 fewer apples than Susan
    mark_apples = susan_apples - mark_fewer_apples

    # L4
    total_children_apples = apples_per_child + apples_per_child + susan_apples + mark_apples

    # L5
    mom_needs_apples = 40 # needs 40 apples
    apples_left_over = total_children_apples - mom_needs_apples

    # FA
    answer = apples_left_over
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Greg and Sarah will split their apples, so {total_apples_to_split} apples / {num_children_splitting} = <<{total_apples_to_split}/{num_children_splitting}={apples_per_child}>>{apples_per_child} apples per child.

Combined the children have {apples_per_child} apples + {apples_per_child} apples + {susan_apples} apples + {mark_apples} apples = <<{apples_per_child}+{apples_per_child}+{susan_apples}+{mark_apples}={total_children_apples}>>{total_children_apples} apples.
Mom will have {total_children_apples} apples - {mom_needs_apples} apples = <<{total_children_apples}-{mom_needs_apples}={apples_left_over}>>{apples_left_over} apples left over.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Greg and Sarah will split their apples, so 18 apples / 2 = <<18/2=9>>9 apples per child.

explanation: Incorrect final answer. An intermediate value 'mark_apples' (value: 13.0) was reported instead of 'apples_left_over' (value: 9.0).
